ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this course I learned so many great ideas.

This course for me was about making links, about finding highways, crossroads, and even back alleys across a multitude of disciplines. Ideas that would seem otherwise disconnected were bridged with the easiest facility by the course readings and by Henry. A wonderful seminar. Would recommend it to any student with an eye for problem solving and a desire to have his/her mind opened to a complex and confusing world of thought.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was wonderful. I always looked forward to the Tuesday seminars.

The main strength is the reading list. What a wonderful set of books, each of which made me want to keep reading into the night and then buy the author's other books. And the way Henry was able to bring them all into a broader, more complex conversation about systems, incredible!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely! If you want to learn how you think, take this course.

Yes! This course was shared by graduate and undergraduate students and there was a great spirit of learning in the classroom. Its a course that will fundamentally challenge the way one engages with political, artistic, and communicative systems around there. There was room for everyones diverse interest and academic specialties to be represented here as well. It wasnt a class for any one major.
It was an honor and a privilege to take Henry Sussman's course.
